Returns: A float[] where each element is an interpolation between the same index in startValue and endValue.
Parameters: float: The fraction from the starting to the ending values
evaluate(float, float[], float[]).Description: Interpolates the value at each index by the fraction. If @B_android#animation#FloatArrayEvaluator#FloatArrayEvaluator_E@ was used to construct this object, reuseArray will be returned, otherwise a new float[] will be returned.
evaluate(float, float[], float[]).FullName: public float[] evaluate (float fraction, float[] startValue, float[] endValue)

FloatArrayEvaluator().Description: Create a FloatArrayEvaluator that does not reuse the animated value. Care must be taken when using this option because on every evaluation a new float[] will be allocated.

Parameters: float: The array to modify and return from evaluate.
FloatArrayEvaluator(float[]).Description: Create a FloatArrayEvaluator that reuses reuseArray for every evaluate() call. Caution must be taken to ensure that the value returned from @B_android#animation#ValueAnimator#getAnimatedValue_E@ is not cached, modified, or used across threads. The value will be modified on each evaluate() call.

Returns: A float[] where each element is an interpolation between the same index in startValue and endValue.
Parameters: float: The fraction from the starting to the ending values
evaluate(float,float[],float[]).Description: Interpolates the value at each index by the fraction. If @B_android#animation#FloatArrayEvaluator#FloatArrayEvaluator_E@ was used to construct this object, reuseArray will be returned, otherwise a new float[] will be returned.
evaluate(float,float[],float[]).FullName: public float[] evaluate (float fraction, float[] startValue, float[] endValue)

ClassDesc: This evaluator can be used to perform type interpolation between float[] values. Each index into the array is treated as a separate value to interpolate. For example, evaluating {100, 200} and {300, 400} will interpolate the value at the first index between 100 and 300 and the value at the second index value between 200 and 400.
